dialogues.ZOE:
[1]I can't believe I didn't get a pedicure for this. How embarrassing. Look at that...

[8]And glasses, too.

[11]No, and I won't have to.

[13]Come on, we don't have to have sex.

[21]Well, then he's late. And I hate people who are late. And what if he's not right around the corner? What if he's miles away?

[66]Okay. Let's see...um, I own a pet store on Hudson Street. Dogs, cats, rabbits...no birds, they creep me out. Before that, I worked for Google, which I completely hated. One day, I decided life was too short, and, against my accountant's advice, I quit Google, cashed out and bought the pet store. Now I'm really happy on the work front, but I still haven't found, you know, the one. 
[67]I always imagined I'd be married with kids by now, but it doesn't look like it's going to happen that way. So, time for Plan B.

[75]He works at the Farmer's market. And it's right around the corner. Are you thinking what I'm thinking?

[78]Oh, well. 
[79]No, I'm fine.

[84]Honestly, I didn't know anyone did either. 
[85]No, not at all. 
[86]I think it's interesting.    Really.

dialogues.STAN:
[1]You own it? 
[2]Actually, if we're being technical, you kind of stole it. 
[3]If you see someone about to get in a cab, you can't just run in from the other side and say it's yours. 
[4]I saw you see me.

[12]That's nice. I hope it continues.

[14]Hi.

[16]I'm sorry. I didn't mean to scare you. Or hurt your dog. Don't worry, I'm not a stalker. 
[17]I followed you after the subway. That sounds a little stalkery, huh? 
[18]I just really wanted to see you again. Almost like I had to see you again. Can I walk you home? Is it me or does everything I say make me sound more like a stalker? 
[19]Can I just give you my card? Here. Take my card. I'm not a freak. Really. I sell cheese. 
[20]Yeah. My family has a goat farm. We make cheese. You like cheese? 
[21]Little Goat. Maybe you've seen us at the Farmer's market? Come by sometime and you can taste my cheese. Okay, I'm going to go. This has not gone as planned. 
[22]A-ha! I didn't scare you away after all. 
[23]I love blueberry pie. 
[24]What makes you think I don't?

But from the day we met, from the first time our backs accidentally touched in the subway, I feel this, this... Maybe this is too much to say right now, but...I love you, Zoe. I really do.

You came and found me at the Farmer's Market even though the night before I acted like a total stalker...

dialogues.BOBBY:
[1]Number CRM-101404? Are you high? 
[2]Says here he has red hair and freckles. 
[3]And why are we picking him? 
[4]He's ugly. 
[5]Have you ever fucked a guy with red hair and freckles? 
[6]But what about your kid? No one's going to want to fuck your kid. That came out wrong. 
[7]What?    I can't be the father! 
[8]Oh, Jesus, I didn't even think about that. Rewind, rewind, rewind... 
[9]Yeah, but...that's too much. I'll walk your dog, tell you when you look fat, be honest about your eyebrows... 
[10]You know I flee at the slightest chance of intimacy. Do you see these bags under my eyes? Ricardo slept over last night, and he wanted to hold me. I actually had to fake a seizure. 
[11]Oh, my God, you're glowing. She's glowing, right? 
[12]Everything. 
[13]You just got shot up with a wad of red-headed-freckle sperm. There's something to tell. 
[14]I tried to talk her out of it. 
[15]I know, right? 
[16]You'll see your kid's pubes. 
[17]But you'll know they're there. 
[18]Sounds like Ricardo. 
[19]So...what happens now? 
[20]That's no fun, I want to know if I'm going to be a fairy godmother. 
[21]Come on, Zoe, one drink. You can have an O'Dhouls or something. 
[22]Forget it, she's not coming. I can tell by the dull look on her face. 
[23]
[24]
[25]
[26]
[27]

[30]Where's that? 
[31]Okay, I'm looking at a subway map. Which way is Brooklyn? 
[32]You're not a fat ass walrus. You're pregnant. 
[33]Why are you crying? So what?   You missed a stupid wedding. 
[34]You got to have girls' night with me. This is way more fun. 
[35]You can't help it. Being pregnant sucks. You're emotional, and irrational, and you get back fat. 
[36]No.  I'm just kidding. Okay, yes. You have back fat. 
[37]We'll go shopping tomorrow. We'll get some hip maternity clothes... whatever that means. 
[38]What? 
[39]I see the most amazingly wonderful person I know. 
[40]With back fat. 
[41]I see trees of green, red roses too. I see them bloom for me and you... 
[42]I see skies of blue and clouds of white. The bright blessed day, the dark and sacred night... 
[43]And I think to myself...what a wonderful world...

[45]Dance with me. One dance. 
[46]Fine. But it doesn't mean that I won't dance with you. 
[47]Haaaaaay.

[55]What?!

[57]Nana, pull yourself together. This is the biggest moment of Zoe's life, and you can't let her down. I'd slap you right now, but I'm afraid your teeth would fly out. 
[58]Hey, girl.     How ya doing? 
[59]Good. So, I really don't want you to worry, but Nana just passed out at the nurse's station and is now down in the ER getting stitches. 
[60]Everything's under control. Good thing we're at the hospital, right? 
[61]Get back in bed. All is well. Arthur's with her. Now, on to bigger and better...who do you want to be your birthing partner? Your choices are me or Mona. 
[62]I know. They're shitty choices. Do you want me to call your scary lesbian friends from your group? 
[63]We're going to get through this, okay? You just have to really think about it. Who do you want with you in the delivery room? 
[64]Who is the one person you want by your side?
dialogues.MONA:
[1]Forget the whole thing.    It's just a phase... 
[2]You don't want kids.    Trust me. 
[3]Yeah, and it's awful. 
[4]They've ruined my life. 
[5]Have you seen my vagina? 
[6]Do you want to? 
[7]I would do that for you. To prove to you that you don't want to have kids, I will show you my vagina. 
[8]Is it possible you're just a little lonely? You know, you haven't met the right guy and-- 
[9]You never know. He could be right around the corner. 
[10]Why did you join a support group of unattractive, militant lesbians when you have me? 
[11]Sure I am. 
[12]I'm just being honest. And don't even get me started on what childbirth does to your bladder. 
[13]I just peed a little bit. 
[14]Good.   Take your time. 
[15]Do I think it's weird that you're pursuing someone at the exact moment in time that you might be most unavailable? No. Because that's what you do. You sabotage. 
[16]I look fat and old? 
[17]Then, no. 
[18]I can't. This twenty minute breakfast concludes my "me" time for the week. More proof that you should not have kids. 
[19]Then you'll get fat and hormonal and I'll say, "I told you so." 
[20]Then it will work out perfectly. 
[21]Because just when you really like him, you'll break up because you're pregnant and then you never have to put yourself out there and possibly get hurt. That's your dream. 
[22]So, when are you seeing him again? 
[23]Well, don't have sex with him. That's the last thing we need. You get knocked up and we'll have no idea who the father is. 
[24]And then we'll have to do a paternity test. Is it the cheese farmer or the red-pubed bandit? 
[25]Well, bring condoms, just in case. And a pregnancy test. 
[26]I'm not joking. 
[27]Don't panic. Could be a false positive. Take another test. 
[28]Come here. 
[29]Why are you even working out? This is the one time in your life you're allowed to let it go. 
[30]Well, yeah. That's kind of how it goes. 
[31]Come on.   He loves you for you. 
[32]Well, you're knocked up with some stranger's twins. So, already you're not exactly... 
[33]Do you have anything to wear at least? 
[34]Do you really think something happened with the berry girl?    They both said nothing happened. 
[35]So, now you run? 
[36]Do you know the end of the story? Can't you just give him the benefit of the doubt? He seems like such a good guy. 
[37]Yeah, and don't think I don't know the reason for that. You were never going to see this through, Zoe. Never. It was doomed before it began. Just like all of your relationships. You get out before you get hurt. 
[38]Every man is not your father. When are you going to realize that? 
[39]I've known you for thirty years. I know you don't trust people. You and your grandmother, both. She's been engaged to Arthur for how long now? 
[40]She's never going to marry him. Just like you'd never marry Stan. No wonder you ended up with a sperm donor. He'll never let you down. It's your ideal boyfriend. 
[41]I'm sorry.     I went too far. 
[42]This song always makes me cry. 
[43]Is it happy or sad? The words are happy but the song is so sad. 
[44]I'm sorry about the things I said. 
[45]It was really shitty of me. 
[46]Then don't be. 
[47]This was my surprise for after the wedding, but let's hit it. 
[48]Hee-hee, hoo-hoo, hee-hee.
dialogues.NANA:
[1]One more mile to go. Do you have a minute? Talk to Arthur. 
[2]Do you want a nose guard?   I have an extra. 
[3]Don't worry, they can't hear anything anyway. 
[4]What? 
[5]What? 
[6]I can't hear you, darling. 
[7]I'm confused. Isn't this what you wanted? You bought sperm and were inseminated by your doctor. This isn't what we would call an accident. 
[8]

[13]

[15]That man is obsessed with my ass.

[17]No reason to rush into anything. 
[18]You look terrible, dear. 
[19]You must really love him, huh? 
[20]Honey, I'm sure he's wonderful, and I'm sure he loves you, too. But, you have put him in a really awkward position. Having a baby is a big adjustment for any couple. And you're not married. And he's not the father. And you've only been together a little while. And now you're having twins. And-- 
[21]I'm just saying, if he actually wanted to stay with you right now, he'd be the greatest man in the world, and, quite frankly, I don't think any man is that great. 
[22]Arthur's just about the best man I know, and look at him. He's a fucking idiot. 
[23]Me? 
[24]Of course. 
[25]What do I have to do? 
[26]I can do that. 
[27]Are you kidding me? I've been waiting my whole life for this. 
[28]Sleeping. 
[29]He's been like that all morning.    I wore him out last night. 
[30]We were celebrating. We finally set a date. 
[31]So, we'll put the band here and the dance floor right here. 
[32]All of a sudden it just hit me, what am I waiting for? I love him. He loves me. What am I so afraid of? 
[33]You don't seem happy. 
[34]Zoe. 
[35]I'm worried about you, honey. 
[36]I just don't want you to make the same mistakes I made. I've been alone for over thirty years now, and that's too long. Sometimes in life you have to forgive and move on. 
[37]Both, baby. 
[38]Because if you don't learn how to forgive, you will always be stuck in the past. 
[39]You're in labor.   You can't drive. 
[40]You don't have a car or a license. You drive. 
[41]Are you okay? Remember to breathe. Breathe in, breathe out, breathe in. 
[42]Hoo-hoo. Hee-hee... 
[43]Bobby... 
[44]I don't know if I can do this. 
[45]I can't go in with her. 
[46]Help me, Bobby.
dialogues.CAROL:
[1]Everyone, please say hello to Zoe. 
[2]Welcome to Single Mother's By Choice. As the name suggests, we are all single mothers by choice. Some of us have adopted, some conceived with a donor, every story is different, but with the same common denominator. We wanted to have a child, and we didn't need a partner to make it happen. 
[3]Well, when we don't have partners with penises, we do what we've got to do, right? So, tell us a little bit about yourself. 
[4]Ah, yes.   The elusive "one." 
[5]Society tells us we're supposed to find that special person to make us happy and complete. But guess what...you have to create your own happiness. You don't need someone to complete you, some...man. You already are complete. 
[6]If you want to have a baby, we here at Single Mothers By Choice can be your partners. We will be your emotional rocks. 
[7]From inception to college graduation and everything in between. We're here for each other. 
[8]Zoe? 
[9]Where have you been?    You haven't been coming to any-- 
[10]Hello. Are you two-- 
[11]Twins!   That's fantastic! 
[12]Are you okay? Is it a financial concern? There are many programs-- 
[13]Take your time. When you feel like sharing, we're here for you. We're all sisters here. Let's give Zoe some space. When she's ready to talk, we're ready to listen. Deep, cleansing breaths, Zoe. 
[14]Now, in the meantime, does anyone else have anything they want to discuss? Problems? Concerns? 
[15]I knew it! 
[16]I knew you were with that guy! 
[17]I'm going to have to ask you not to come back. 
[18]I don't think we can help you, and, quite frankly, you're against everything we stand for. 
[19]No.  Not you. Do you know how long it took me to conceive? Five years. I had three miscarriages and spent every last dime on in-vitro. And Dana? The woman with the short hair? 
[20]The one with the really short hair? 
[21]She   just flew to Memphis to watch her   baby being born. Seconds after the   birth, the birth mother changed her   mind and refused to give it up. 
[22]So, as you can see, we are really dedicated and choosing to be single mothers, and you seem to be in a slightly different place. You're carrying two healthy babies, and you have no idea how lucky you are. 
[23]I like you, Zoe. We all like you. But you kind of need to figure out where you are. 
[24]Hi, Zoe. 
[25]Zoe, it's so nice of you to come, especially at this crazy hour. 
[26]You have to stay. Lori wants us all to be together for this. 
[27]She's having a contraction. 
[28]The farmer? 
[29]Listen, Zoe, if you're happy, we're happy. We'd love to meet him. Bring him to group any time. 
[30]Come on everybody, it's time. She's getting into the water. 
[31]Oh, it's a water birth.   Didn't Zoe tell you? 
[32]Hi-ya-ya-hi-ya-ya-hi-ya-hi-ya-ya. 
[33]I know. It's amazing how the body can open up like that. 
[34]You can't leave.   You're her focal point. 
[35]She's in labor. You want to argue with her now? 
[36]Hi-ya-ya-hi-ya-ya-hi-ya-hi-ya-ya. 
[37]Sssshh. It's perfectly natural. Sometimes the bowels just let go. Hi-ya-ya-hi-ya-ya-hi-ya-hi-ya-ya. 
[38]Here comes the head. 
[39]There's so much hair! 
[40]Stan, get the mirror!
dialogues.OLIVIA:
[1]Can I help you? 
[2]Tasty, huh? 
[3]All ripe and juicy. And firm, too. Bet you could just eat him up in one bite, right? 
[4]And don't look now, but he's coming this way. 
[5]Aren't you going to introduce me to your new friend? 
[6]Hey, stranger. 
[7]Right. How'd that blueberry pie turn out? 
[8]You bought blueberries from me? Said you were going to make a pie? 
[9]No way she knows how to bake a pie. 
[10]Why aren't you dancing? 
[11]Come on, one dance. 
[12]For old time's sake. 
[13]Never stopped you before. 
[14]Oh, hi. 
[15]Right, hi. 
[16]Wow. Wow. 
[17]It's nothing. 
[18]I had no idea it was that serious. 
[19]It's stupid. I was drunk and... 
[20]You're having a baby? I didn't know you'd been together that long. 
[21]Are you okay? 
[22]Are you in labor?
dialogues.JOAN:
[1]A nap?   Now? She just got here. 
[2]How can I be judgemental?    We haven't even met her yet. 
[3]What the heck is that? 
[4]Who's judging?! 
[5]Would you like a plate? 
[6]A napkin? 
[7]I'm Joan. 
[8]And you must be Zoe. 
[9]So are all the animals in your pet store...differently abled? 
[10]Those puppy mills are terrible.    I read about them in the paper. 
[11]That sounds like us, honey. 
[12]Sometimes in life you just have to take matters into your own hands. Make things happen your own way, you know? 
[13]Oh, I thought you were in your room. Sorry. Everything okay? 
[14]Well, she seems really terrific. Dad and I both think so. She's smart and poised and... 
[15]And warm and gracious... 
[16]And pretty and... 
[17]What the hell's going on in there? 
[18]Oh, dear God. 
[19]You know, people thought we were crazy when we bought this farm. 
[20]All of our friends in New York, they thought we'd lost our minds. 
[21]I guess I'm saying that you may have envisioned your life going one way, but the reality is, it could go a totally different direction. You just have to be open to it. 
[22]I used to work on Wall Street. Now I wear boots covered in goat shit. This isn't how I pictured it, either. But guess what...I'm happy.
dialogues.LORI:
[1]Are you a doer or a tryer? 
[2]Are you already a single mother or are you trying to become one? 
[3]Amen, sister. 
[4]Why are you crying?   That's so lucky. 
[5]Zoe, this group is called Single Mother's By Choice. 
[6]Make sure you put your numbers down. I want to have everyone's number handy in case I go into labor early. 
[7]It's a phone tree. I'm due next month, but my midwife thinks I may go sooner. I want everyone to be there. Are you in? 
[8]You're really one of us now. 
[9]Oh, I'm sure. 
[10]You're not staying? 
[11]Okay.   What was it you were saying? 
[12]Stan who? 
[13]No, I really want you to stay. 
[14]Great.   Invite him up. 
[15]I'm not shy. I've been through this before. It's quite beautiful, really. 
[16]Don't move, Zoe, you're my focal point. 
[17]Don't move, Zoe, I need you! You're my focal point. 
[18]I need to turn over.    Please! 
[19]I want to see the head. Get me a mirror. It's in the bedroom. 
[20]
[21]Look at all that wet, curly hair.
dialogues.JALISA:
[1]Glowing.   Tell us everything. 
[2]He had red hair and freckles? 
[3]Why'd you do that, Mami? 
[4]Red pubes.     Eek... 
[5]So, what happened?    Come on... 
[6]Tell me about it, Papi. 
[7]We'll go to the piano bar and get Bobby to sing some Ace of Base. 
[8]
[9]
[10]
dialogues.WOMAN:
[1]Hi. 
[2]You're starting to freak me out. 
[3]Stop it. 
[4]Hi. 
[5]Hi. 
[6]Hi.
dialogues.ARTHUR:
[1]Hello, my dear! 
[2]Good, because I can't get up. Came to see my lovely fiance? She's looking fine today, let me tell you. Fine. 
[3]That's what I'm talking about. Work it. 
[4]I'll drive. 
[5]Who needs a drink? 
[6]Don't look at me.
